Measuring the success of implementing agile methodologies can be different from measuring traditional project management methodologies. Here are some ways to measure the success of implementing agile methodologies in a company:

1. Delivering working software or products frequently: One of the metrics to measure success when implementing agile methodologies is by delivering working software or products frequently. When you deliver software or products frequently, it means you are delivering business value to customers or stakeholders quickly which leads to increased revenue and profitability.

2. Improved productivity: Agile methodologies can also lead to improved productivity due to its emphasis on collaboration and communication. Measuring productivity can be done by tracking team velocity, lead time, throughput, or other metrics that indicate progress.

3. Improved quality and customer satisfaction: Since agile methodology focuses on delivering working software/products frequently and a higher level of customer involvement throughout the development cycle, it can improve product quality as measured by bug or defect rate, validation time, or customer feedback.

4. Reduced risk: Agile project management can also help to reduce risk in projects. By gradually delivering features and testing them along the way, agile minimizes the risk of developing the wrong product or investing resources in a failing project.

5. Employee satisfaction: Implementing agile methodologies can also lead to improved employee satisfaction due to its emphasis on collaboration, communication, and autonomy. Tracking employee satisfaction can be done through surveys, feedback channels, or retention metrics.

In summary, the success of implementing agile methodologies can be measured by tracking delivery frequency, productivity, quality, customer satisfaction, risk reduction, and employee satisfaction.
